objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The authoring organization of the threat report, as indicated by the copyright, disclaimer, and author metadata in the YARA rules.

objects.name: Primary C2 Domain
objects.description: C2 domain used for downloading the second stage, exfiltration, and persistence.

objects.name: Secondary C2 Domain
objects.description: C2 domain found in an unexecuted VBScript code block within the Word document.

objects.name: Second-stage Download URL
objects.description: URL used by the initial macro to download the second-stage VBScript.

objects.name: Exfiltration URL
objects.description: URL endpoint used to exfiltrate system enumeration data.

objects.name: Persistence URL
objects.description: URL contacted by a scheduled task every 10 minutes for persistence.

objects.name: Secondary C2 URL
objects.description: URL found in an unexecuted VBScript code block, intended to download and execute code.

objects.name: Additional C2 URL
objects.description: Additional C2 URI path identified from YARA rule DevilBait_C2.

objects.name: Additional C2 URL
objects.description: Additional C2 URI path identified from YARA rule DevilBait_C2.

objects.name: First-stage VBScript Dropper Location
objects.description: The VBA macro from the Word document writes the first-stage VBScript to this location before execution.

objects.name: System Enumeration Output File
objects.description: The second-stage VBScript writes the output of system enumeration commands to this file.

objects.name: Encoded Exfiltration File
objects.description: Stores the base64-encoded system enumeration data before it is exfiltrated.

objects.name: IE Registry Modification
objects.description: Modified by unexecuted VBScript to prevent Internet Explorer from diverting to a homepage.

objects.name: IE Registry Modification
objects.description: Modified by unexecuted VBScript to prevent Internet Explorer from checking if it is the default browser.

objects.name: Indicator for Devil Bait Word Document (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the malicious macro-enabled document '체불확인원-김보라.doc'.

objects.name: Indicator for Devil Bait Word Document (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the malicious macro-enabled document '체불확인원-김보라.doc'.

objects.name: Indicator for Devil Bait Word Document (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the malicious macro-enabled document '체불확인원-김보라.doc'.

objects.name: Indicator for Devil Bait VBScript (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the second-stage VBScript, retrieved by VirusTotal sandbox as 'data.txt'.

objects.name: Indicator for Devil Bait VBScript (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the second-stage VBScript, retrieved by VirusTotal sandbox as 'data.txt'.

objects.name: Indicator for Devil Bait VBScript (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the second-stage VBScript, retrieved by VirusTotal sandbox as 'data.txt'.

objects.name: devil bait
objects.description: A two-stage malware, initiated by a malicious macro-enabled Microsoft Word document targeting Korean speakers. The first stage downloads and executes a second-stage VBScript. It uses 'live off the land' binaries for system enumeration, data exfiltration over HTTP, and achieves persistence via a Scheduled Task that beacons to a C2 server every 10 minutes.

objects.name: VirusTotal
objects.description: An online service used as a sandbox to retrieve the second-stage VBScript of Devil Bait and for retro-hunting to find other malware variants.

objects.name: AhnLab
objects.description: A legitimate endpoint security product popular in South Korea, which Devil Bait masquerades as for its persistence mechanism (scheduled task named 'AhnlabUpdate').

objects.name: Microsoft
objects.description: The vendor of the software products (Word, Office, Windows, Internet Explorer) that are leveraged or targeted by the Devil Bait malware.

objects.name: Kimsuky
objects.description: A threat actor group associated with the TTPs observed in Devil Bait, specifically masquerading persistence mechanisms as AhnLab (a South Korean security product) and using the string 'Update' in autorun names.

objects.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter
objects.description: Devil Bait uses the WScript shell from within other scripts to spawn cmd.exe instances to collect system information.

objects.name: Scheduled Task/Job: Scheduled Task
objects.description: Devil Bait creates a Scheduled Task to beacon every 10 minutes.

objects.name: Application Layer Protocol: Web Protocols
objects.description: Devil Bait Command and Control is achieved over HTTP using the scripting object ServerXMLHTTP.

objects.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
objects.description: Devil Bait sends system enumeration data over HTTP to the C2 server.

objects.name: Masquerading: Match Legitimate Name or Location
objects.description: Devil Bait masquerades as AhnLab, a legitimate security product, in its persistence mechanism.

objects.name: DevilBait_vbscript_2
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DevilBait_vbscript_2 {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "These strings appear in second stage VBScript used
by Devil Bait."

    strings:
       $ = "WScript.Shell" nocase
       $ = "Scripting.FileSystemObject" nocase
       $ = "MSXML2.ServerXMLHTTP.6.0" nocase
       $ = "FolderExists" nocase
       $ = "certutil" nocase
       $ = "vbCrLf" nocase
       $ = "expandenvironmentstrings" nocase
       $ = "%appdata%" nocase
    condition:

    filesize < 20KB and all of them

}

objects.name: DevilBait_Maldoc
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DevilBait_Maldoc {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "These strings appear in the Devil Bait malicious
document."

    strings:

   $word = "MSWordDoc"
   $ms_xml = "MSXML2.ServerXMLHTTP.6.0"
   $ = {53 65 6E 64 3A 45 78 65 63 75 74 65 28 [1-6] 2E 72 65 73 70

6F 6E 73 65 54 65 78 74 29}// Send:Execute(<variable>.responseText)

   $ = "wscript.exe //e:vbscript"

    condition:

    all of them

}

objects.name: DevilBait_C2
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DevilBait_C2 {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "C2 and IoC strings found in Devil Bait second
stage vbscript."

    strings:
       $file_1 = "sr011.xml"

       $must_func = "Roller"
       $must_C2 = ".co.kr"

       $c2_1 = "cross.php"
       $c2_2 = "report.php"
       $c2_3 = "list.php"
       $c2_4 = "show.php"
    condition:
        $file_1 and any of ($must_*) and any of ($c2_*)
}

objects.name: DevilBait_vbscript_1
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DevilBait_vbscript_1 {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule identifies the first stage vbscript
written to disk e.g. version.xml."

    strings:
        $must_1 = "On Error Resume Next:Set"
        $must_2 = "CreateObject(\"MSXML2.ServerXMLHTTP.6.0\"):"
        $must_3 = ".Send:Execute("
        $must_4 = "http"
        $get = "GET"
        $post = "POST"
    condition:

    filesize < 10KB and all of ($must*) and ($get or $post)

}

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Devil Bait
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. devil bait.
